description: The Add Only Flag  indicates that the service is an add only, not an update. If an instance already exists and this flag is set, an error will occur.

Calibration_ProgramObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Calibration_ProgramObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Calibration_ProgramObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Calibration_Program_Data.description: The ID of the calibration program.
The name of the calibration program.
The description of the calibration program.
Determines when the calibration event should end.
Determines whether the calibration program is inactive or active.
When true, you can perform potential assessment during calibration.
When true, the calibration skips the first participant.

validation.validation: The nBox report in a Calibration Program must use the Report Data Source, Indexed In Progress Worker Calibration Placements.

Calibration_Program_Data.description: nBox cell limit determines the maximum number of workers visible per cell in the calibration nBox. You can change the nBox cell limit to optimize performance.

validation.validation: You can use the Box Cell only once in the Calibration Program.

description: Contains all information associated with the calibration program.

validation.validation: You can change the Autocomplete First Participant field when the calibration program is not in use.
You can use the Box Cell only once in the Calibration Program.
The row value must be from the available list of report fields.
You can only use Box Cells that are specified in the nBox report for this calibration program.

Not a valid nBox cell limit. Acceptable limit values are 100, 500, 1,000, 2,000.
